CSSColumn-gap.summary: The column-gap CSS property sets the size of the gap (Gutters) between an element's columns.

remarks.para: Initially a part of Multi-column Layout, the definition of column-gap has been broadened to include multiple layout methods. Now specified in Box Alignment, it may be used in Multi-column, Flexible Box, and Grid layouts.
Early versions of the specification called this property grid-column-gap, and to maintain compatibility with legacy websites, browsers will still accept grid-column-gap as an alias for column-gap.

-Related CSS properties: row-gap, gap
